item.description:
Change of plans - I just heard about this wonderful free event. Various arts organizations in the Fenway area are "opening their doors" and running tons of FREE activities, workshops, concerts and more on Columbus Day, many of them geared towards families!

There is a kickoff at the Christian Science Plaza at 10am with a concert by the Boston Children's Chorus and a cupcake birthday cake from Kick@ss Cupcakes (among other stuff), followed by a kids' parade - babies in strollers welcome - with the Hot Tamale Brass Band.

From there, we can call it a day or see what else we want to do. The entire program is viewable online, and there is a FREE Olde Towne trolley that will take you venue to venue!

Some events I thought looked good:
11:45am Stacey Peasley concert
1:30pm Boston Symphony Orchestra instrument "petting" zoo
2:30pm Odaiko New England (Japanese drumming)
all-day glass-blowing demonstrations
item.name: Screw the Picnic, the Fenway Alliance is "Opening Our Doors"
